docblock.description: Return a list of available locale identifiers

docblock.description: Try to guess the full locale (with script and territory) ID associated to a language

tag.name: param
tag.description: ='' The language identifier (if empty we'll use the current default language)

tag.name: param
tag.description: ='' The script identifier (if $language is empty we'll use the current default script)

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns an empty string if the territory was not found, the territory ID otherwise

docblock.description: Return the terrotory associated to the locale (guess it if it's not present in $locale)

docblock.description: Return the node associated to the language (not locale) territory

tag.name: param

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns null if the node was not found, the node data otherwise

docblock.description: Returns the item of an array associated to a locale

tag.name: param
tag.description: The data containing the locale info

tag.name: param
tag.description: ='' The locale identifier (if empty we'll use the current default locale)

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns null if $data is not an array or it does not contain locale info, the array item otherwise

docblock.description: Convert a date/time representation to a \DateTime instance

tag.name: param
tag.description: A unix timestamp, a \DateTime instance or a string accepted by strtotime

tag.name: param
tag.description: The timezone to set; leave empty to use the default timezone (or the timezone associated to $value if it's already a \DateTime)

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns null if $value is empty, a \DateTime instance otherwise

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws an exception if $value is not empty and can't be converted to a \DateTime instance

docblock.description: Converts a format string from PHP's date format to ISO format Remember that Zend Date always returns localized string, so a month name which returns the english month in php's date() will return the translated month name with this function.
docblock.long-description:
.. use 'en' as locale if you are in need of the original english names
The conversion has the following restrictions: 'a', 'A' - Meridiem is not explicit upper/lowercase, you have to upper/lowercase the translated value yourself

tag.name: param
tag.description: Format string in PHP's date format

tag.name: return
tag.description: Format string in ISO format

docblock.description: Get the name of an era

tag.name: param
tag.description: A year or a \DateTime instance

tag.name: param
tag.description: = 'abbreviated' The format name; it can be 'wide' (eg 'Before Christ'), 'abbreviated' (eg 'BC') or 'narrow' (eg 'B')

tag.name: param
tag.description: = '' The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns an empty string if $value is empty, the name of the era otherwise

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws an exception in case of problems

docblock.description: Get the name of a month

tag.name: param
tag.description: A month number (1-12) or a \DateTime instance

tag.name: param
tag.description: = 'wide' The format name; it can be 'wide' (eg 'January'), 'abbreviated' (eg 'Jan') or 'narrow' (eg 'J')

tag.name: param
tag.description: = '' The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

tag.name: param
tag.description: = false Set to true to return the form used independently (such as in calendar header)

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns an empty string if $value is empty, the name of the month name otherwise

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws an exception in case of problems

docblock.description: Get the name of a weekday

tag.name: param
tag.description: A weekday number (from 0-Sunday to 6-Saturnday) or a \DateTime instance

tag.name: param
tag.description: = 'wide' The format name; it can be 'wide' (eg 'Sunday'), 'abbreviated' (eg 'Sun'), 'short' (eg 'Su') or 'narrow' (eg 'S')

tag.name: param
tag.description: = '' The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

tag.name: param
tag.description: = false Set to true to return the form used independently (such as in calendar header)

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns an empty string if $value is empty, the name of the weekday name otherwise

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws an exception in case of problems

docblock.description: Get the name of a quarter

tag.name: param
tag.description: A quarter number (from 1 to 4) or a \DateTime instance

tag.name: param
tag.description: = 'wide' The format name; it can be 'wide' (eg '1st quarter'), 'abbreviated' (eg 'Q1') or 'narrow' (eg '1')

tag.name: param
tag.description: = '' The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

tag.name: param
tag.description: = false Set to true to return the form used independently (such as in calendar header)

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns an empty string if $value is empty, the name of the quarter name otherwise

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws an exception in case of problems

docblock.description: Get the name of a day period (AM/PM)

tag.name: param
tag.description: An hour (from 0 to 23), a standard period name('am' or 'pm', lower or upper case) or a \DateTime instance

tag.name: param
tag.description: = 'wide' The format name; it can be 'wide' (eg 'AM'), 'abbreviated' (eg 'AM') or 'narrow' (eg 'a')

tag.name: param
tag.description: = '' The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

tag.name: param
tag.description: = false Set to true to return the form used independently (such as in calendar header)

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns an empty string if $value is empty, the name of the period name otherwise

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws an exception in case of problems

docblock.description: Returns the localized name of a timezone

tag.name: param
tag.description: The php name of a timezone, or a \DateTime instance or a \DateTimeZone instance

tag.name: param
tag.description: = 'long' The format name; it can be 'long' (eg 'Greenwich Mean Time') or 'short' (eg 'GMT')

tag.name: param
tag.description: = '' Set to 'daylight' to retrieve the daylight saving time name, set to 'standard' to retrieve the standard time, set to 'generic' to retrieve the generic name, set to '' to determine automatically the dst (if $value is \DateTime) or the generic (otherwise)

tag.name: param
tag.description: = '' The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns an empty string if the timezone has not been found (maybe we don't have the data in the specified $width), the timezone name otherwise

tag.name: todo
tag.description: I can't find data for this

docblock.description: Returns the localized name of an exemplar city for a specific timezone

tag.name: param
tag.description: The php name of a timezone, or a \DateTime instance or a \DateTimeZone instance

tag.name: param
tag.description: true If the exemplar city is not found, shall we return the translation of 'Unknown City'?

tag.name: param
tag.description: = '' The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns an empty string if the exemplar city hasn't been found and $returnUnknownIfNotFound is false

docblock.description: Returns true if a locale has a 12-hour clock, false if 24-hour clock

tag.name: param
tag.description: = '' The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws an exception in case of problems

docblock.description: Retrieve the first weekday for a specific locale (from 0-Sunday to 6-Saturnday)

tag.name: param
tag.description: = '' The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns a number from 0 (Sunday) to 7 (Saturnday)

docblock.description: Get the ISO format for a date

tag.name: param
tag.description: The format name; it can be 'full' (eg 'EEEE, MMMM d, y' - 'Wednesday, August 20, 2014'), 'long' (eg 'MMMM d, y' - 'August 20, 2014'), 'medium' (eg 'MMM d, y' - 'August 20, 2014') or 'short' (eg 'M/d/yy' - '8/20/14')

tag.name: param
tag.description: = '' The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the requested ISO format

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws an exception in case of problems

docblock.description: Get the ISO format for a time

tag.name: param
tag.description: The format name; it can be 'full' (eg 'h:mm:ss a zzzz' - '11:42:13 AM GMT+2:00'), 'long' (eg 'h:mm:ss a z' - '11:42:13 AM GMT+2:00'), 'medium' (eg 'h:mm:ss a' - '11:42:13 AM') or 'short' (eg 'h:mm a' - '11:42 AM')

tag.name: param
tag.description: = '' The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the requested ISO format

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws an exception in case of problems

docblock.description: Get the ISO format for a date/time

tag.name: param
tag.description: The format name; it can be 'full', 'long', 'medium', 'short' or a combination for date+time like 'full|short' or a combination for format+date+time like 'full|full|short'

tag.name: param
tag.description: = '' The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the requested ISO format

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws an exception in case of problems

docblock.description: Returns the difference in days between two dates (or between a date and today)

tag.name: param
tag.description: The first date

tag.name: param
tag.description: The final date (if it has a timezone different than $dateEnd, we'll use the one of $dateEnd)

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns the diffence $dateEnd - $dateStart in days

docblock.description: Describe an interval between two dates (eg '2 days and 4 hours').

tag.name: param
tag.description: The first date

tag.name: param
tag.description: The final date (if it has a timezone different than $dateEnd, we'll use the one of $dateEnd)

tag.name: param
tag.description: = 2 The maximim parts (eg with 2 you may have '2 days and 4 hours', with 3 '2 days, 4 hours and 24 minutes')

tag.name: param
tag.description: = 'short' The format name; it can be 'long' (eg '3 seconds'), 'short' (eg '3 s') or 'narrow' (eg '3s')

tag.name: param
tag.description: = '' The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

tag.name: param
tag.description: The \DateTime instance for which you want the localized textual representation

tag.name: param
tag.description:
The format name; it can be 'full' (eg 'EEEE, MMMM d, y' - 'Wednesday, August 20, 2014'), 'long' (eg 'MMMM d, y' - 'August 20, 2014'), 'medium' (eg 'MMM d, y' - 'August 20, 2014') or 'short' (eg 'M/d/yy' - '8/20/14').

                 You can also append a caret ('^') or an asterisk ('*') to $width. If so, special day names may be used (like 'Today', 'Yesterday', 'Tomorrow' with '^' and 'today', 'yesterday', 'tomorrow' width '*') instead of the date.

tag.name: param
tag.description: = '' The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns an empty string if $value is empty, the localized textual representation otherwise

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws an exception in case of problems

docblock.description: Format a date (extended version: various date/time representations - see toDateTime())

tag.name: param
tag.description: The \DateTime instance for which you want the localized textual representation

tag.name: param
tag.description:
The format name; it can be 'full' (eg 'EEEE, MMMM d, y' - 'Wednesday, August 20, 2014'), 'long' (eg 'MMMM d, y' - 'August 20, 2014'), 'medium' (eg 'MMM d, y' - 'August 20, 2014') or 'short' (eg 'M/d/yy' - '8/20/14')

                 You can also append a caret ('^') or an asterisk ('*') to $width. If so, special day names may be used (like 'Today', 'Yesterday', 'Tomorrow' with '^' and 'today', 'yesterday', 'tomorrow' width '*') instead of the date.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The timezone to set; leave empty to use the default timezone (or the timezone associated to $value if it's already a \DateTime)

tag.name: param
tag.description: = '' The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns an empty string if $value is empty, the localized textual representation otherwise

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws an exception in case of problems

tag.name: param
tag.description: The \DateTime instance for which you want the localized textual representation

tag.name: param
tag.description: The format name; it can be 'full' (eg 'h:mm:ss a zzzz' - '11:42:13 AM GMT+2:00'), 'long' (eg 'h:mm:ss a z' - '11:42:13 AM GMT+2:00'), 'medium' (eg 'h:mm:ss a' - '11:42:13 AM') or 'short' (eg 'h:mm a' - '11:42 AM')

tag.name: param
tag.description: = '' The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns an empty string if $value is empty, the localized textual representation otherwise

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws an exception in case of problems

tag.name: param

The format name; it can be 'full', 'long', 'medium', 'short' or a combination for date+time like 'full|short' or a combination for format+date+time like 'full|full|short'

                 You can also append an asterisk ('*') to the date parh of $width. If so, special day names may be used (like 'Today', 'Yesterday', 'Tomorrow') instead of the date part.

tag.name: param

docblock.description: Return the list of applicable plural rule for a locale

tag.name: param
tag.description: = '' The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns a list containing some the following values: 'zero', 'one', 'two', 'few', 'many', 'other' ('other' will be always there)

docblock.description: Return the plural rule ('zero', 'one', 'two', 'few', 'many' or 'other') for a number and a locale

tag.name: param
tag.description: The number to check the plural rule for for

tag.name: param
tag.description: = '' The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns one of the following values: 'zero', 'one', 'two', 'few', 'many', 'other'

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws a \Punic\Exception\BadArgumentType if $number is not a valid number

tag.name: throws
tag.description: Throws a \Exception if there were problems calculating the plural rule

docblock.description: Concatenates a list of items returning a localized string (for instance: array(1, 2, 3) will result in '1, 2, and 3' for English or '1, 2 e 3' for Italian)

tag.description: The list to concatenate

tag.name: param
tag.description: = '' The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns an empty string if $list is not an array of it it's empty, the joined items otherwise.

docblock.description: Concatenates a list of unit items returning a localized string (for instance: array('3 ft', '2 in') will result in '3 ft, 2 in'

tag.description: The list to concatenate

tag.description: = '' The preferred width ('' for default, or 'short' or 'narrow')

tag.name: param
tag.description: = '' The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns an empty string if $list is not an array of it it's empty, the joined items otherwise.
